intro: Diplocyclos leiocarpus, commonly known as the Mexican red bean, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, red, bean-like seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit includes woody stems and hairy foliage, typical of many shrubs in its native habitat. The botanical features of Diplocyclos leiocarpus make it an important species in ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
